## Load files & set helpful variable that could recur

### Load in genome annotation file (gencode gtf v44)

```{r}
gencode_v44 <-import("~/fusions/Data/ReferenceGenome/gencode.v44.annotation.gtf") %>%
  as.data.frame(.) # convert from large genomic ranges type to df

gencode_v44_genes <- gencode_v44 %>%
  filter(type == "gene") # 62700 genes
```

### Load cell line summary tsv

```{r}
cellLine_summary <- cellLine_summary # recall, this was created already in identifyCellLines

# Subset cellLine_summary
id_tiss_acc_size <- cellLine_summary %>%
  select(
    sampleID,
    tissueType,
    rna_run_accession,
    rna_size_MB,

```

### Set paths

```{r}
# Paths to the fusion tsvs
fusionTranscriptsDir <- "~/fusions/05_PreliminaryAnalysis/fusionTranscripts"

tsv_paths <-
  list.files(
    fusionTranscriptsDir,
    recursive = TRUE,
    full.names = TRUE,
    pattern = "\\.tsv$"
  )
```

# Create a large dataframe with every predicted fusion

## Data frame that stores information about each TSV

```{r}
# df with path, RNA run accession, program used to generate it
tsv_info <- tibble(
  path = tsv_paths,
  rna_run_accession = str_extract(tsv_paths, "(?<=/)[^/]+(?=/[^/]+$)"), # regex to pull the RNA-Seq run accession from the directory name in the path

  program = case_when(
    # set program to:
    str_detect(tsv_paths, "arriba_") ~ "arriba", # arriba when the path includes "arriba_", protein domain annotations from Arriba provided Pfam annotations
    str_detect(tsv_paths, "arribaUCSCproteinDomains1based") ~ "arriba_UCSCpfam", # identical Arriba predictions except retained protein domain annotations come from UCSC data integrator Pfam
    str_detect(tsv_paths, "star-fusion") ~ "star-fusion" # star-fusion when the path includes "star-fusion"
  )
)

# Bind with the summary we already made (RNA-Seq/WGS run accession, program, number of transcripts, sample ID, tissue type, size MB)
tsv_info <- tsv_info %>%
  left_join(id_tiss_acc_size, by = c("rna_run_accession"))
```

## Create and run function to load all the fusion data into one df

```{r}
load_and_annotate_tsv <-
  function(file_path,
           run_accession_rna,
           run_accession_wgs,
           program_name,
           ID,
           tissue_type) {
    dat <-
      read_tsv(file_path, show_col_types = FALSE) # read in tsv file with fusions. show_col_types = FALSE to silence stdout

    # Annotate with the metadata
    dat <- dat %>%
      mutate(
        rna_run_accession = run_accession_rna,
        wgs_run_accession = run_accession_wgs,
        program = program_name,
        sampleID = ID,
        tissueType = tissue_type # don't need rna_size_MB & numberOfTranscripts since each fusion will be one entry in the df and this info is regarding the whole cell line
      )

    return(dat)
  }

all_fusion_data <- tsv_info %>%
  # Add a col named "data" to tsv_info, the column is a list composed of data frames for each TSV
  mutate(data = pmap(
    list(
      path,
      rna_run_accession,
      wgs_run_accession,
      program,
      sampleID,
      tissueType
    ),
    load_and_annotate_tsv
  )) %>% # when each tsv is loaded, we are adding the the associated RNA-Seq run acc, WGS run acc, program, etc. as specified in the function
  pull(data) %>% # pull just the data column
  bind_rows() %>% # combine all the data frames into one
  relocate(rna_run_accession,
    wgs_run_accession,
    program,
    sampleID,
    tissueType,
    .before = `#gene1`
  ) %>% # move the descriptive columns to the start of the data frame
  dplyr::rename(
    gene1 = "#gene1", # rename the first column in the Arriba output
    FusionName = "#FusionName"
  ) # rename the first column in the STAR-Fusion output
```

# Rename columns and split some columns into new ones

```{r}
all_fusion_data_arriba_updated <- all_fusion_data_arriba %>%
  separate(
    `strand1(gene/fusion)`,
    c("fiveprime_gene_strand", "fiveprime_transcribed_strand"),
    sep = "/"
  ) %>%
  separate(
    `strand2(gene/fusion)`,
    c("threeprime_gene_strand", "threeprime_transcribed_strand"),
    sep = "/"
  ) %>%
  separate(breakpoint1,
    c("hg38_fiveprime_chr", "hg38_fiveprime_fusion_junction"),
    sep = ":"
  ) %>%
  separate(breakpoint2,
    c("hg38_threeprime_chr", "hg38_threeprime_fusion_junction"),
    sep = ":"
  ) %>%
  select(-closest_genomic_breakpoint1, -closest_genomic_breakpoint2) %>% # we didn't provide Arriba with WGS data! Will not have any "closest genomic breakpoint" entries
  mutate(
    fusion_name = paste(gene1, gene2, sep = "::"), # create a fusion name column for the fusion pair based on the gene symbols/names
    geneID_fusionName = paste(gene_id1, gene_id2, sep = "::"), # create a fusion name column for the fusion pair based on the gene IDs
  ) %>%
  dplyr::rename(
    fiveprime_gene_name = "gene1",
    threeprime_gene_name = "gene2",
    fiveprime_junctionSite_arriba = "site1",
    threeprime_junctionSite_arriba = "site2",
    fusionType_arriba = "type",
    fiveprime_split_reads_arriba = "split_reads1",
    threeprime_split_reads_arriba = "split_reads2",
    discordant_mates_arriba = "discordant_mates",
    fiveprime_coverage_arriba = "coverage1",
    threeprime_coverage_arriba = "coverage2",
    confidence_arriba = "confidence",
    reading_frame_arriba = "reading_frame",
    tags_arriba = "tags",
    retained_protein_domains_PfamArriba_arriba = "retained_protein_domains",
    retained_protein_domains_PfamUCSC_arriba = "retained_protein_domains_Pfam_ucsc",
    fiveprime_geneID = "gene_id1",
    threeprime_geneID = "gene_id2",
    fiveprime_transcript_id_arriba = "transcript_id1", # best matching isoform that is transcribed
    threeprime_transcript_id_arriba = "transcript_id2", # best matching isoform that is transcribed
    fiveprime_direction_arriba = "direction1", # per Arriba, good if transcribed strand prediction fails
    threeprime_direction_arriba = "direction2",
    filters_arriba = "filters",
    fusion_transcript_arriba = "fusion_transcript",
    peptide_sequence_arriba = "peptide_sequence", # predicted by Arriba
    read_identifiers_arriba = "read_identifiers"
  ) %>%
  mutate(reading_frame_arriba = case_when(
    (reading_frame_arriba == ".") ~ "unknown",
    TRUE ~ reading_frame_arriba # keep existing if not a "."
  )) %>%
  mutate(
    tags_arriba = if_else(tags_arriba == ".", "none", tags_arriba),
    retained_protein_domains_PfamArriba_arriba = if_else(
      retained_protein_domains_PfamArriba_arriba == ".",
      "none",
      retained_protein_domains_PfamArriba_arriba
    ),
    retained_protein_domains_PfamUCSC_arriba = if_else(
      retained_protein_domains_PfamUCSC_arriba == ".",
      "none",
      retained_protein_domains_PfamUCSC_arriba
    ),
    filters_arriba = if_else(filters_arriba == ".", "none", filters_arriba),
    fiveprime_transcript_id_arriba = if_else(
      fiveprime_transcript_id_arriba == ".",
      "unknown",
      fiveprime_transcript_id_arriba
    ),
    threeprime_transcript_id_arriba = if_else(
      threeprime_transcript_id_arriba == ".",
      "unknown",
      threeprime_transcript_id_arriba
    ),
    peptide_sequence_arriba = if_else(
      peptide_sequence_arriba == ".",
      "unknown",
      peptide_sequence_arriba
    )
  )

all_fusion_data_sf_updated <- all_fusion_data_sf %>%
  mutate(
    fiveprime_gene_name = sub("\\^.*", "", LeftGene), # isolate the STAR-Fusion left (5') Gene IDs, name before the ^
    threeprime_gene_name = sub("\\^.*", "", RightGene), # isolate the STAR-Fusion right (3') Gene IDs, name before the ^
    fiveprime_geneID = sub(".*\\^", "", LeftGene), # isolate the STAR-Fusion left (5') Gene IDs, id after the ^
    threeprime_geneID = sub(".*\\^", "", RightGene), # isolate the STAR-Fusion right (3') Gene IDs, id after the ^
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    fusion_name = paste(fiveprime_gene_name, threeprime_gene_name, sep = "::"), # create a fusion name column for the fusion pair based on the gene symbols/names
    geneID_fusionName = paste(fiveprime_geneID, threeprime_geneID, sep = "::"), # create a fusion name column for the fusion pair based on the gene IDs
  ) %>%
  select(-FusionName, -LeftGene, -RightGene) %>% # drop the original sf columns now that we formatted new versions above
  separate(
    LeftBreakpoint,
    c(
      "hg38_fiveprime_chr",
      "hg38_fiveprime_fusion_junction",
      "fiveprime_transcribed_strand"
    ),
    sep = ":"
  ) %>%
  mutate(fiveprime_gene_strand = fiveprime_transcribed_strand) %>% # STAR-Fusion only outputs sense transcription predictions! Plus sanity checked it
  separate(
    RightBreakpoint,
    c(
      "hg38_threeprime_chr",
      "hg38_threeprime_fusion_junction",
      "threeprime_transcribed_strand"
    ),
    sep = ":"
  ) %>%
  mutate(threeprime_gene_strand = threeprime_transcribed_strand) %>% # again, STAR-Fusion only outputs sense transcription predictions! Plus sanity checked it
  dplyr::rename(
    junctionReadCount_sf = "JunctionReadCount",
    spanningFragCount_sf = "SpanningFragCount",
    est_J_sf = "est_J",
    est_S_sf = "est_S",
    spliceType_sf = "SpliceType",
    largeAnchorSupport_sf = "LargeAnchorSupport",
    ffpm_sf = "FFPM", # fusion fragments per million reads
    fiveprime_BreakDinuc_sf = "LeftBreakDinuc", # dinucleotide seqs surrounding fusion junction
    fiveprime_BreakEntropy_sf = "LeftBreakEntropy", # Shannon entropy of bases flanking fusion junction
    threeprime_BreakDinuc_sf = "RightBreakDinuc",
    threeprime_BreakEntropy_sf = "RightBreakEntropy",
    annots_sf = "annots",
    fiveprime_cds_ID_sf = "CDS_LEFT_ID",
    fiveprime_cds_range_sf = "CDS_LEFT_RANGE",
    threeprime_cds_ID_sf = "CDS_RIGHT_ID",
    threeprime_cds_range_sf = "CDS_RIGHT_RANGE",
    reading_frame_sf = "PROT_FUSION_TYPE",
    fusion_model_sf = "FUSION_MODEL", # predicted structure of the fusion
    fusion_cds_sf = "FUSION_CDS",
    fusion_transl_sf = "FUSION_TRANSL",
    fiveprime_pfam_sf = "PFAM_LEFT",
    threeprime_pfam_sf = "PFAM_RIGHT"
  ) %>%
  mutate(reading_frame_sf = case_when(
    (reading_frame_sf == "FRAMESHIFT") ~ "out-of-frame",
    (reading_frame_sf == "INFRAME") ~ "in-frame",
    (reading_frame_sf == ".") ~ "unknown"
  )) %>%
  mutate(
    annots_sf = if_else(annots_sf == ".", "none", annots_sf),
    fiveprime_cds_ID_sf = if_else(fiveprime_cds_ID_sf == ".", "unknown", fiveprime_cds_ID_sf), # sf selects candidate fusion isoform
    fiveprime_cds_range_sf = if_else(
      fiveprime_cds_range_sf == ".",
      "unknown",
      fiveprime_cds_range_sf
    ),
    threeprime_cds_ID_sf = if_else(threeprime_cds_ID_sf == ".", "unknown", threeprime_cds_ID_sf), # sf selects candidate fusion isoform
    threeprime_cds_range_sf = if_else(
      threeprime_cds_range_sf == ".",
      "unknown",
      threeprime_cds_range_sf
    ),
    fusion_model_sf = if_else(fusion_model_sf == ".", "unknown", fusion_model_sf), # not predicted
    fusion_cds_sf = if_else(fusion_cds_sf == ".", "unknown", fusion_cds_sf),
    fusion_transl_sf = if_else(fusion_transl_sf == ".", "unknown", fusion_transl_sf),
    fiveprime_pfam_sf = if_else(fiveprime_pfam_sf == ".", "none", fiveprime_pfam_sf),
    threeprime_pfam_sf = if_else(threeprime_pfam_sf == ".", "none", threeprime_pfam_sf)
  )


all_fusion_data_updated <- all_fusion_data_arriba_updated %>%
  bind_rows(all_fusion_data_sf_updated) %>% # 45679 rows (Arriba = 39556, STAR-Fusion = 6123)
  left_join(

    hg38_fiveprime_gene_gtfStart = "start",
    hg38_fiveprime_gene_gtfEnd = "end",
    fiveprime_gene_type = "gene_type",
    fiveprime_gtf_strand = "strand",
    fiveprime_gtf_gene_name = "gene_name"
  ) %>%
  left_join(
    gencode_v44_genes %>% select(seqnames, start, end, strand, gene_id, gene_type, gene_name),
    by = c(
      "hg38_threeprime_chr" = "seqnames",
      "threeprime_geneID" = "gene_id"
    )
  ) %>%
  dplyr::rename(
    hg38_threeprime_gene_gtfStart = "start",
    hg38_threeprime_gene_gtfEnd = "end",
    threeprime_gene_type = "gene_type",
    threeprime_gtf_strand = "strand",
    threeprime_gtf_gene_name = "gene_name"
  ) %>%
  # Update so they are numeric like all other coordinates!
  mutate(across(
    c(
      hg38_fiveprime_fusion_junction,
      hg38_threeprime_fusion_junction
    ),
    as.numeric
  ))
```

- Prior to filtering
  - *Arriba* = 39556 fusion transcript predictions
  - *STAR-Fusion* = 6123 fusion transcript predictions
  
# Filter the fusion data

```{r}
# Filter out fusions with fusion junctions in intergenic regions

all_fusion_data_filtered <-
  all_fusion_data_updated %>% # 45679 rows before filtering

  # If the program is Arriba, exclude sites where the junction is in marked to be in an intergenic region
  filter(
    !(
      fiveprime_junctionSite_arriba == "intergenic" |
        threeprime_junctionSite_arriba == "intergenic"
    ) |
      program != "arriba"
  ) %>% # Removes 9400 rows 36729 rows left (Arriba = 30606, STAR-Fusion = 6123)

  # If the program is Arriba and the 5' or 3' partner's strand that was transcribed could not be predicted, then remove! We need to know sense. The "." in gene strand were filtered out when we filtered out intergenic junctions for Arriba
  filter(fiveprime_transcribed_strand != "." &
    fiveprime_transcribed_strand != ".") %>% # Removes 1246 rows 35483 rows left (Arriba = 29360, STAR-Fusion = 6123)

  # If the program is STAR-Fusion, exclude IG superlocus fusions! @ indicates superlocus, STAR-Fusion GRCh38.v44 gencode gtf includes these superlocus sites (critical in leukemia but not much else) and can't find matches in our regular GRCh38.v44 gencode gtf. The geneIDs are formatted differently and can't find them even in the star-fusion gencode gtf so we have nothing to map to in the standard gencode gtf
  filter(!str_detect(fusion_name, "@")) %>% # Removes 27 rows 35456 rows left (Arriba = 29360, STAR-Fusion = 6096)

  filter(
    fiveprime_gene_strand == fiveprime_gtf_strand &
      threeprime_gene_strand == threeprime_gtf_strand
  ) %>% # Still 35456 rows, passed sanity check! Supports STAR-Fusion paper which says only sense predictions are kept!

  mutate(fiveprime_transcriptionType = case_when(
    (fiveprime_gene_strand == fiveprime_transcribed_strand) ~ "sense",
    (fiveprime_gene_strand != fiveprime_transcribed_strand) ~ "antisense"
  )) %>%
  mutate(threeprime_transcriptionType = case_when(
    (threeprime_gene_strand == threeprime_transcribed_strand) ~ "sense",
    (threeprime_gene_strand != threeprime_transcribed_strand) ~ "antisense"
  )) %>%
  # 5560 instances of antisense transcription (Arriba only!)

  filter(
    fiveprime_gene_name == fiveprime_gtf_gene_name &
      threeprime_gene_name == threeprime_gtf_gene_name
  ) %>% # Still 35456 rows, passed sanity check! No discrepancies in gene name with left join based on ID

  select(
    -fiveprime_gtf_strand,
    -threeprime_gtf_strand,
    -fiveprime_gtf_gene_name,
    -threeprime_gtf_gene_name
  ) %>% # get rid of these columns now that sanity check passed

  filter((
    hg38_fiveprime_gene_gtfStart <= hg38_fiveprime_fusion_junction &
      hg38_fiveprime_fusion_junction <= hg38_fiveprime_gene_gtfEnd
  ) &
    (
      hg38_threeprime_gene_gtfStart <= hg38_threeprime_fusion_junction &
        hg38_threeprime_fusion_junction <= hg38_threeprime_gene_gtfEnd
    )) %>% # 35225 rows (Arriba = 29360, STAR-Fusion = 5865) 231 STAR-Fusion predictions failed sanity check! Junction was in intergenic region! No Arriba filtered out because we already filtered out when we removed the ones flagged "intergenic"

  filter(fiveprime_geneID != threeprime_geneID) %>% # filter out the 1370 inragenic Arriba predictions! Now 33855 rows total

   # Use select to relocate columns! 70 columns
  select(
    fusion_name,
    geneID_fusionName,
    rna_run_accession,
    wgs_run_accession,
    sampleID,
    tissueType,
    program,
    fiveprime_gene_name,
    fiveprime_geneID,
    fiveprime_gene_type,
    hg38_fiveprime_chr,
    fiveprime_gene_strand,
    fiveprime_transcribed_strand,
    hg38_fiveprime_gene_gtfStart,
    hg38_fiveprime_fusion_junction,
    hg38_fiveprime_gene_gtfEnd,
    threeprime_gene_name,
    threeprime_geneID,
    threeprime_gene_type,
    hg38_threeprime_chr,
    threeprime_gene_strand,
    threeprime_transcribed_strand,
    hg38_threeprime_gene_gtfStart,
    hg38_threeprime_fusion_junction,
    hg38_threeprime_gene_gtfEnd,
    fiveprime_transcriptionType,
    threeprime_transcriptionType,
    reading_frame_arriba,
    fiveprime_junctionSite_arriba,
    threeprime_junctionSite_arriba,
    fusionType_arriba,
    confidence_arriba,
    tags_arriba,
    retained_protein_domains_PfamArriba_arriba,
    retained_protein_domains_PfamUCSC_arriba,
    fiveprime_split_reads_arriba,
    threeprime_split_reads_arriba,
    discordant_mates_arriba,
    fiveprime_coverage_arriba,
    threeprime_coverage_arriba,
    fiveprime_transcript_id_arriba,
    threeprime_transcript_id_arriba,
    fiveprime_direction_arriba,
    threeprime_direction_arriba,
    filters_arriba,
    fusion_transcript_arriba,
    peptide_sequence_arriba,
    read_identifiers_arriba,
    reading_frame_sf,
    fiveprime_pfam_sf,
    threeprime_pfam_sf,
    annots_sf,
    junctionReadCount_sf,
    spanningFragCount_sf,
    est_J_sf,
    est_S_sf,
    spliceType_sf,
    largeAnchorSupport_sf,
    ffpm_sf,
    fiveprime_BreakDinuc_sf,
    fiveprime_BreakEntropy_sf,
    threeprime_BreakDinuc_sf,
    threeprime_BreakEntropy_sf,
    fiveprime_cds_ID_sf,
    fiveprime_cds_range_sf,
    threeprime_cds_ID_sf,
    threeprime_cds_range_sf,
    fusion_model_sf,
    fusion_cds_sf,
    fusion_transl_sf
  ) %>% # Still 70 columns

  mutate(fusion_id = row_number()) %>% # add an ID column to easily identify each fusion. Now 71 columns!

  relocate(fusion_id, .before = fusion_name)
```

  - *STAR-Fusion* = 5,865 fusion transcript predictions
